subject: Vam motors problems
description_text:
Hi! I bought an upgrade kit and vam motors for my Pro Plus pedals from your
official store on AliExpress. I will paste here the message I just sent to
the seller and include a video I just made showing what is going on.

------------------------------------------------------
Hi! I had problems with two of the vam motors last night. I've been waiting
to use them since they arrived, because there were other parts of my setup
that I had to get delivered and they took a while to get to me. So I only
set them up and used them yesterday. They felt really good and worked
flawlessly for about three hours, and then the one I set to the clutch
became very loud and the one on the brakes stopped working. I changed their
connection on the control box and they would behave the same at wherever
input they were connected. I really liked the vam system and the pedals and
it was really a bummer that it worked for only that short period of time.
How can we solve this? It was really expensive to me and I had to save for
a long time to get this upgrade to my setup.
My order number is 8204864367111732.
------------------------------------------------------

Can you help me whith it?

 VID_20251028_121523614.mp4
<https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QmGRswi2_V3ZZM8GKO8e-jiUzo3C7AUA/view?usp=drive_web>

conversations.body_text: Hi Daniel Boaventura,  Are you using SIMSONN Manager or SIMHUB for telemetry? Also, please select the VAM motor type for testing. From the sound of the motor, it doesn’t seem like a VAM type — it sounds more like VAM Pro. Please go to Settings → Update → Manual Update → Pedals → firmware → pedals-plusx.sfu, then, after the update, select VAM motor type again for testing. Do not use the VAM Pro mode.

I'm using SIMSONN Manager. I updated it as soon as I installed it. As you
can see in the video, I had Vam mode selected, not Vam Pro. Let me explain
the problem again: Motor 3 (clutch) is very loud, even with low force;
Motor 2 (brakes) stopped working completely and Motor 1 (accelerator) is
fine, working strong and quiet. After I removed Motor 2 from the pedal, I
managed to make it work briefly by shaking it with my hand when clicking
the test button. It seems like it could have some internal bad connection.
To be completely clear: Motor 3 is loud when connected to whatever input on
the control box, Motor 2 doesn't work when connected to any input and Motor
3 works normally and quietly when connected to whatever input, all of them
using the fully updated SIMSONN Manager and with Vam Mode selected, as seen
in the video I included in my first message. That makes me believe that the
problem is really with the motors 3 and 2, and not with a wrong mode
selection in the SIMSONN manager or even the control box.

I hope we can get to a solution for this problem, because I really liked
the SIMSONN products that I purchased: the 7+R gear shifter and the Pro
Plus pedals set that I purchased from a store here in Brazil, and the
upgrade kit for the pedals and the Vam system that I bought from the
SIMSONN Official Store on AliExpress, while it worked.

Em ter., 28 de out. de 2025 às 23:17, service@simsonn.com <
service@simsonn.com> escreveu:

> I only set them up and used them yesterday. They felt really good and

> clutch became very loud and the one on the brakes stopped working. I
> changed their connection on the control box and they would behave the same
> at wherever input they were connected. I really liked the vam system and
> the pedals and it was really a bummer that it worked for only that short
> period of time. How can we solve this? It was really expensive to me and I
> had to save for a long time to get this upgrade to my setup.
> My order number is 8204864367111732.
> ------------------------------------------------------

> Can you help me whith it?

>  VID_20251028_121523614.mp4
> <https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QmGRswi2_V3ZZM8GKO8e-jiUzo3C7AUA/view?usp=drive_web>
>
> 5370:4206036
>

Hi Daniel Boaventura,   Please provide your order number, contact person, phone number, and shipping address, and we will resend two VAM units to you. You can also disassemble the two damaged units and send us some photos, so we can better understand what went wrong.

That's great! Thank you!

Order number: 8204864367111732

Contact person: Daniel Boaventura

Phone number: +55 62 9 8133-3475

Shipping adress: Avenida Tocantins n. 207 apto. 1305 Ed. Rio Sao Francisco,
Setor Central, Goiania - GO, Brazil, CEP 74015-010

Can you send me instructions to disassemble the motors? I just now tried
removing the four screws but it did not open it.



Em qua., 29 de out. de 2025, 02:44, service@simsonn.com
Hi Daniel Boaventura,  After removing the four screws, you can use some force to split the device into two halves.

This is Motor 2, which ceased to function completely. I had to insert a
screwdriver to apply the necessary force and ended up damaging the case. As
I suspected, a bad connection. The black wire snapped out of the motor
contact.

I will wait for the two motors that you will send me to arrive to open the
Motor 3 that is making a very loud noise, because I'm using it on a very
low force on the brakes, so I still have some feeling while, despite the
noise. I don't want to risk damaging it and losing its functionality.

Em qua., 29 de out. de 2025, 03:16, service@simsonn.com

I removed the glued motor from the bottom carcass and, after further
inspection, I could see that the black wire was not detached from the
motor. So I proceeded to check if the wiring connection was good and now I
suspect (since I'm not a technician) that there is a short inside the
motor. In the videos I'm including below, I used a multimeter to check the
continuity and it gave contact on both poles.
 VID_20251029_125554378.mp4
<https://drive.google.com/file/d/1FCEf3D0N_n-xX_MOaNRPmCSsJ2buzsAb/view?usp=drive_web>
 VID_20251029_125758960.mp4
<https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ov8us10fjo7Si2mOchL_22HacWkVIFGt/view?usp=drive_web>

I'm a little embarrassed by my ignorance lol

I tested the continuity the same way on the functioning motors and the
results were the same. My guess is that in brushed motors they are in
contact in the axle. So for them it's normal this result. In that case, the
reason for this motor to have stopped working is a mystery to me, since it
don't have any apparent problems. At least that a layman can detect.

Order number: 8204864367111732

Contact person: Daniel Boaventura

Phone number: +55 62 9 8133-3475

Shipping adress: Avenida Tocantins n. 207 apto. 1305 Ed. Rio Sao Francisco,
Setor Central, Goiania - GO, Brazil, CEP 74015-010

Hi Daniel Boaventura,  Your order has been shipped. The logistics number is:YT2530300704405611. You can track it at this website:https://t.17track.net/zh-cn#nums=YT2530300704405611
